description:
A bipartisan group of four US Senators on Wednesday recommended Congress allocate $32 billion during the next three years to develop artificial intelligence (AI) and to put in place regulatory guardrails around it.

Led by Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY), two Democrats and two Republicans developed
title: Senators propose $32B on AI spending without firm regulatory oversight

description:
Meta has outlined plans to retire Workplace, the enterprise social network it launched in 2016. 

Customers can continue to use the app until August 2025, after which access will be read-only. Workplace will then be decommissioned entirely in June 2026. 

The launch of Workplace eight years ago was Meta’s — then Facebook — first major foray into enterprise software, arriving amid a surge of interest in digital workplace tools lead by team chat app Slack. Workplace is essentially a business-friendly version of the Facebook consumer social network, with features such as group chat, live video, and knowledge library.

 In addition to desk workers, Workplace has in recent
title: Meta signals the end of the road for Workplace

description:
With government money to spur them on, the semiconductor industry in the US is forging ahead with dozens of projects to expand domestic manufacturing.

But there’s a big problem: not enough labor to staff those new or upgraded facilities once they’re completed, according to a new report from professional service firm McKinsey & Co. The talent needed to meet the surge in chip demand, which is particularly acute because of artificial intelligence (AI) adoption, spans three distinct labor pools — construction
title: There aren’t nearly enough workers to support new US chip production

description:
Perhaps building on lessons learned by developing eye-tracking controls for the Vision Pro, Apple today announced AI-driven eye-tracking support for the iPad and iPhone. The idea is that it becomes possible to use apps on the iPad using only your eyes.

The feature is part of the latest package of accessibility features Apple unveiled to mark Global Accessibility Awareness Day. It touts new accessibility features every year at this time — last year the company introduced Assistiv
title: Soon, you’ll control your iPhone with a glance

description:
Ilya Sutskever, co-founder and chief scientist of OpenAI, is leaving.

He will be replaced by former director of research Jakub Pachocki.

Sutskever announced his departure from the San Francisco-based creator of ChatGPT in a posting on social network X.

“After almost a decade, I have made the decision to leave OpenAI,” Sutskever wrote, adding, “I’m confident that OpenAI will build AGI that is both safe and beneficial” under the leadership of CEO and cofounder Sam Altman, cofounder Greg Brockman, and chief technology officer Mira Murati.

Sutskever hasn’t always been so confident of that. Ba
title: OpenAI chief scientist Ilya Sutskever is leaving

description:
Microsoft and OpenAI are joined at the hip, with Microsoft investing $13 billion in the pioneering generative AI (genAI) company; holding a seat on its board; and using OpenAI’s ChatGPT technology in its Copilot tool (now built into virtually its entire product line).

And that’s just the beginning of the relationship. The tag team of Microsoft President Brad Smith and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have lobbied elected leaders to fend off federal AI regulations, wined and dined members of Congress, and become their go-to experts about everything AI. 

Whe
title: Microsoft and OpenAI: BFFs, or soon-to-be frenemies?

description: ChatGPT, Microsoft Copilot, and Google Gemini all run on servers in distant data centers, even as the PC industry works on moving generative AI (genAI) chatbots onto your PC. But you don’t have to wait for that to happen — in a few clicks, you can already install and run
title: The best way to run private AI chatbots on your Windows PC
